Utilities

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utilities.Config

  • public class Config
extends java.lang.Object
    Configuration Manager.

    Used to handle configuration files for software

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Config(java.lang.String fullDir)
      Default Constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean exists()
      Check if the configuration file exists
      java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key)
      Retrieve the value of a setting in the config file.
      int numberOfSettings()
      get the number of settings stored in the configuration file.
      void reload()
      reload the configuration file and all of its settings.
      void save()
      Saves the configuration file
      void set(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      set the value of a setting, or add a new setting, to the config file

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Config

        public Config(java.lang.String fullDir)
       throws ConfigurationException
        Default Constructor
        Parameters:
        fullDir - Full path to the configuration file, including file name. Ex: 'C:\Users\Default\Desktop\config.cfg'
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - Throws if there is an issue creating or handling the configuration file. Details of the error are found in the message.

    • Method Detail

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Check if the configuration file exists
        Returns:
        true if it exists, else false.

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key)
        Retrieve the value of a setting in the config file.
        Parameters:
        key - associated with the setting
        Returns:
        String containing the value of the setting

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.String value)
        set the value of a setting, or add a new setting, to the config file
        Parameters:
        key - you want associated with the setting. Ex: 'musicDir'
        value - you want stored. Ex: 'F:\Media\Music'

      • save

        public void save()
          throws ConfigurationException
        Saves the configuration file
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if there is an issue saving the file. Details are in the message.

      • reload

        public void reload()
            throws ConfigurationException
        reload the configuration file and all of its settings.
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if there is an issue loading the file. Details are in the message.

      • numberOfSettings

        public int numberOfSettings()
        get the number of settings stored in the configuration file.
        Returns:
        int value of number of settings.
